thread.title: John Barker says Hawthorn can’t be beaten as it strives for historic three-peat | The
thread.title_full: John Barker says Hawthorn can’t be beaten as it strives for historic three-peat | The Advertiser

title: John Barker says Hawthorn can’t be beaten as it strives for historic three-peat | The
text:
CARLTON interim coach John Barker says rivals should forget about the 2015 premiership race as the Hawks can’t be beaten.
After watching his side be humiliated by the AFL’s hottest team, Barker — himself a former Hawkthorn player and assistant coach — said he couldn’t see anyone troubling Alastair Clarkson’s team as it strives for three straight flags.
After watching his team suffer a 138-point flogging to the reigning back-to-back premier, Barker was asked if he could possibly see anyone beating the Hawks to the 2015 premiership to which he simply replied: “No.”
MITCHELL: CAREY OFF MARK WITH CALL
MATCH: BLUES’ WORST-EVER LOSS
BARKER: ‘WE HAVE WORK TO DO’
CLARKO: BELTINGS NOT GOOD FOR GAME
Who can challenge Hawthorn in 2015?
When asked just how much below their best the Hawks would need to be for anyone to stand a chance of upsetting them come September, Barker emphasised just how far ahead of their nearest rivals he believed they were.
“They’ve rolled out onto the park in the last two weeks (against Fremantle and Sydney) and made very quick work of two of the best four teams in the comp,” he said.
“They’re going pretty well.
“They’re in good nick. They play well together, they’re well drilled.
“You know obviously I’ve come out of that system, I understand Clarko’s ways, and he’s a very good coach.”
Hawthorn's Magnificent Month
Round 14 - def Collingwood by 10 points Round 15 - def Fremantle by 72 points Round 16 - def Sydney by 89 points Round 17 - def Carlton by 138 points
No quick fix for Blues 1:09 Play video
AFL: Carlton have suffered the biggest defeat in their history at the hands of Hawthorn and John Barker's chances to become Carlton's full time coach suffered a massive blow.
Fox Sports 25 Jul 2015 Sport/AFL/News Originally published as Hawks can’t be beaten: Barker
